Module eqc_mcerlang

McErlang integration for Quviq QuickCheck.

Version: 1.26.2

Description

McErlang integration for Quviq QuickCheck

Copyright Quviq AB, 2010

McErlang is a model checker for Erlang. It can be used to analyze a large sub-set of existing Erlang code, exposing hard to find concurrency defects. McErlang itself is an open source project, currently being developed inside the ProTest research project. This package contains a few modules necessary for checking an interesting class of concurrency (QuickCheck) properties with McErlang, and this package should be used in parallel to the McErlang application.

Function Details

check_scheduler/2

check_scheduler(Sched::atom(), Mods::[atom()]) -> ok | {error, not_consistently_instrumented}

Check that a set of modules are all instrumented with a particular scheduler.

seed/0

seed() -> gen(seed())

Seed generator to be used when using a combination of model checking and shrinking, e.g. mce_app:simulate_then_verify/1. The idea is to have QuickCheck generate a seed with this generator and pass this on to McErlang.

which_scheduler/1

which_scheduler(Mod::atom()) -> atom()

Find out which scheduler (if any) a given module is instrumented for.
